node.title: Valtteri Bottas Moves to a New Challenge in F1
node.alt: Valtteri Bottas said he learned a lot about himself racing for Mercedes. “I learned how this sport is actually so much more mental,” he said. “If you really compare, if it’s a physical or a mental sport, I feel like it’s so much about the head.”
node.description: He is leaving Mercedes, where he helped the team win five championships, for Alfa Romeo next season.
node.content: ["After five years with Mercedes, Valtteri Bottas has bittersweet feelings about his time with the team.", "Bottas won 10 Grands Prix, scored 20 pole positions and helped Mercedes win five consecutive constructors\u2019 titles.", "The problem for Bottas was that he was teammate to Lewis Hamilton and unable to realize his dream of winning a drivers\u2019 championship.", "\u201cYes, I definitely feel like, in a way, it is a failure,\u201d Bottas said in an interview. \u201cBut looking back I tried everything I could have done.", "\u201cIf I could go back in time, if I could relive those moments, I would still just drive my best, as I did.\u201d", "Thinking positively, Bottas, who joins the Alfa Romeo team next season, said, \u201cThat\u2019s going to be important moving on, thinking about the constructors\u2019 titles we won together, the huge amount of points.", "\u201cWe\u2019ve been very good teammates, I got some wins, had plenty of poles, so I need to take those good things with me so when I look back I think that, yes, I achieved something, maybe not yet the big chunk of gold I said to myself I would win when I was 6 years old, but still something.\u201d", "Hamilton said Bottas \u201cis the best teammate there has ever been in this sport.\u201d", "In a social media post from Hamilton when Bottas\u2019 departure was confirmed Hamilton said, \u201cYour speed and resilience has been impressive, but where you truly stand out to me is the human being you are. You are greater than you know, and I know there\u2019s a bright future ahead for you.\u201d", "When Bottas joined the team from Williams in 2017 he hoped to emulate Nico Rosberg of Mercedes, who had beaten Hamilton to the title in 2016.", "During his five seasons with Hamilton, Bottas said that \u201coverall\u201d he was treated fairly by Mercedes.", "\u201cEspecially always in the beginnings of a season until the halfway point, for sure,\u201d Bottas said. \u201cIf there was a points gap, then naturally people inside the team start to think it\u2019s most likely going to be this driver who\u2019s going to fight for the championship and not this one.", "\u201cSubconsciously, it can change the behavior of some people and their decision making.\u201d", "On occasions, there were \u201cvery clear cases\u201d when he had to play a supporting role to Hamilton that affected him mentally. In the Russian Grand Prix in 2018, for example, Bottas was leading the race when he was asked to let Hamilton by to take the victory. He was again told to give way to Hamilton at the Spanish Grand Prix this year.", "\u201cI would say the first time that happened was probably in 2018, and it was really hard to accept,\u201d Bottas said. \u201cIt was pretty tough.", "\u201cThat wasn\u2019t good for me mentally, the space I was in mentally. As time goes on, do you accept it if that\u2019s the situation you\u2019re in, being behind in the points? It makes it difficult.\u201d", "Bottas, who is from Finland, said he learned a lot about himself with Mercedes. He said he believed he joins Alfa Romeo as a stronger person.", "\u201cI learned how this sport is actually so much more mental,\u201d Bottas said. \u201cIf you really compare, if it\u2019s a physical or a mental sport, I feel like it\u2019s so much about the head.\u201d", "Bottas will need his new mental strength when he joins Alfa Romeo. He leaves a championship-winning team for one that has scored only 21 points over the last two seasons, with a best result of eighth.", "He is hoping the changes to the aerodynamic regulations for next season, aimed at closing the disparity between the 10 teams and leading to closer fighting on the track, will push Alfa Romeo nearer the front.", "\u201cI questioned myself, do I want this, or should I try doing something else?\u201d Bottas said. \u201cThat was also an option, but I never seriously considered leaving Formula 1 because deep inside me, I still love Formula 1, the competition and many things about it.\u201d"]
